at once render its presence obvious.
Again we are not at present acquainted 
with irritable fluids - nor with any 
living matter that <u>expands <\u> on
irritation -
A hypothesis which has no support 
and is in plain contradiction to the best 
known facts of Physics & Physiology is 
hardly admissible into the Philosophical 
Transactions 
T.H. Huxley
The Committee of Papers 
Royal Society
